p: The K 3Fe(CN) 6 solution after reaction with copper metal was analyzed via UV–vis spectroscopy. Copper powder (10 mmol) was dispersed into 100 mL of 10 mM K 3Fe(CN) 6 solution for 40 h with vigorous stirring. The molar amount of copper powder was 10 times that of K 3Fe(CN) 6 to enable the complete reaction of the K 3Fe(CN) 6 solution. The reacted K 3Fe(CN) 6 solution was collected using a centrifuge, and its absorbance was measured. The spectrum of the reacted solution showed the absence of ferricyanide ions ( Figure 4d), which indicates that the K 3Fe(CN) 6 solution was reduced by copper metal and proves that copper was oxidized via Fe(CN) 6 3− reduction, as explained in the proposed mechanism of CuHCFe thin film deposition.
